parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandated for campaign materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly refers to Brian Cristian, a candidate for the parliamentary elections.  The hashtags #briancristian, #briancristian2024, and #briancristiandeputat, along with the mention of his website and his role as a deputy, clearly identify him as the subject.  This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags further amplifies its reach beyond a personal communication. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's objective is clearly to promote Brian Cristian's candidacy.  Phrases like "Informați-vă corect când vă alegeți parlamentarii" (Inform yourselves correctly when you choose your parliamentarians), "să avem o România pentru toți, nu doar pentru unii!" (let's have a Romania for everyone, not just for some!), and the highlighting of his legislative achievements directly aim to influence voters' choices. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. While it mentions legislative achievements, it does so in a promotional context, lacking the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.  It's promotional material, not news.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted campaign message designed to persuade voters. The emphasis on accomplishments and the call to action are not characteristics of a personal opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2308499799504251</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria of electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Brian Cristian), is clearly intended for a wide audience (paid Facebook ad), has an explicitly electoral objective (promoting his candidacy), and does not adhere to journalistic standards of objectivity. The presence of a CMF number further reinforces this conclusion.  The post's end date (1732867200) corresponds to November 23, 2024, after 18:00, which is after the official end of the electoral campaign period.  Therefore, it violates Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR Maramures</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 2308499799504251) cu scop electoral, care promovează candidatura lui Brian Cristian, conținând afirmații precum „Informați-vă corect când vă alegeți parlamentarii” și „să avem o România pentru toți, nu doar pentru unii!”,  precum și evidențierea realizărilor sale legislative, toate acestea având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului menționat, în clară încălcare a prevederilor legale privind încetarea campaniei electorale. Prezența numărului CMF 11240015 confirmă natura electorală a postării.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
